The practices carried out by bodhisattvas are called the eye seeing all dharmas. A bodhisattva does not hope for anything in the Dharma of ordinary people, does not seek anything in the Dharma of the Buddha, and does not have any doubts about the Dharma of ordinary people. The Dharma of the Buddha and the Dharma of ordinary people are no different.

The Dharma is the Dharma, and it is called the Dharma abode, the Dharma extinction, and the Dharma tranquility. In this, one does not see oneself and does not see anything else;

The Dharma and the sound of the Dharma, that good sound is the good sound, but it cannot be obtained in this;

Thus, it is no self, and in this, it is said that there is no abiding, no non-abiding, and no going.

All dharmas are thus uncountable, and the Buddha Dharma is also not separate.

It is like this, you should view all dharmas and the Buddha Dharma in this way, and always contemplate practicing in this way.

Further contemplate practicing in this way, and in this give rise to the contemplation of non-perception, practice the contemplation of non-perception, and also do not think about anything in the Buddha Dharma. One who does this is said to be in accordance with contemplation, and gives rise to;
No longer engaging in this wisdom, there is nothing to be added to the Dharma realm, nor does it abide or not abide.
Furthermore, cultivating the wisdom of dharmas, there is nothing that can be added or subtracted from the Dharma.

Whether there are dharmas of desire or dharmas without desire, all are aware of what is desire and what is without desire.
Having already understood this, one does not follow it again.

The bodhisattva attains the profound practice, and ultimately does not see the Dharma, and also ultimately does not view the Buddha Dharma in this way, does not see in this way, does not perceive in this way, and does not see by doing this.
